intro: Euphorbia itremensis, commonly known as the Itremensis spurge, is a succulent plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a structure called a cyathium. It is adapted to arid environments and can store water in its stems for survival. Euphorbia itremensis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
